attributes.action: Put a stop to the £300,000 Margaret Thatcher statue in Grantham!!
attributes.additional_details:
“A controversial £300,000 Margaret Thatcher statue is set to be approved despite concerns it will be a “likely target for politically-motivated vandals”.”

“The application, by Grantham Community Heritage Association (GCHA), which runs the Grantham Museum, has received 17 letters of objection to the proposals, mainly noting Mrs Thatcher’s position as a “divisive figure” and the potential of crime and disorder.”
Both posted by The Grantham Journal @ 15:23 on 29/01/2019
attributes.background:
£300,000 to be spent on a 6.4m tall Maggy Thatcher statue to go in the center of Grantham town.. Need I say anymore.
There have been 17 letters of objection against these plans yet it is still to go ahead. This is YOUR chance to put a stop to something a small fraction of people want.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for. This is the responsibility of the local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
